Both cover the same core areas: script overview, complexity metrics, syntax analysis, manual adjustments, complexity scoring, optimization techniques, and API cost calculation.

Both outputs address the same fundamental goal of analyzing a SQL script that generates customer order summaries. They both identify the same key database objects (raw.orders, raw.users, raw.order_items, raw.products), same number of joins (3), and same CTEs (customer_orders, order_summary). However, Agent 2 provides more SQL Server-specific insights and business context, while Agent 1 takes a more database-agnostic approach. The core intent and understanding are highly aligned.

Both outputs follow nearly identical structural organization with 7 main sections: Script Overview, Complexity Metrics, Syntax Analysis, Manual Adjustments, Complexity Score, Optimization Techniques, and API Cost Calculation. Agent 2 includes additional subsections and more detailed breakdowns within each section, but the overall flow and logical decomposition are remarkably similar. Both use consistent formatting and hierarchical organization.

Agent 1 output is syntactically well-formed with consistent formatting, proper section numbering, and accurate technical details.
